dicomreader

Class DicomReader

  • java.lang.Object
    • dicomreader.DicomReader

  • public class DicomReader
extends java.lang.Object
    The DicomReader class decodes Dicom files writing headers file and images files.
    The image(s) files is simply composed of ascii pixel values ordered by rows and columns as in a trivial image.
    Version:
    1.3.1
    Author:
    Salvatore La Bua < slabua (at) gmail.com >
    See Also:
    LoadDict

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description

      The decode method is the main method of the class.
      It will use other private methods to do the more simplest functions such as checks, informations reading/writing...

      Three parameters static method of the decode method.

      Four parameters static method of the decode method.
      static java.lang.String getAppVersion()
      The method returns the version variable value.
      boolean getAsciiSaved()
      The method returns the asciiSaved variable value.
      True is returned if the ascii image file is stored.
      boolean getHeadersSaved()
      The method returns the headersSaved variable value.
      True is returned if the headers file is stored.
      boolean getImageSaved()
      The method returns the imageSaved variable value.
      True is returned if the pgm image file is stored.
      boolean getIsDicomFile()
      The method returns the isDicomFile variable value.
      True is returned if the file to convert is recognized as a valid Dicom file.
      static void main(java.lang.String[] args)
      The main methods of the class simply calls the decode static method.

      • DicomReader

        public DicomReader(java.io.File dfn,
           java.io.File hfn,
           java.io.File afn,
           java.io.File ifn)
        Four parametrs DicomReader class constructor.
        The constructor simply initializes variables' values to file names passed as parameters to the class.
        Parameters:
        dfn - File Dicom file name to decode.
        hfn - File Headers file name.
        afn - File Ascii image file name.
        ifn - File PGM-P2 image file name.
